metadata.titel_preek: Epiphany: The Fear of the Lord and the New Thing

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades the mundane and sinful reality of human subjects to sovereignly bestow grace and a new identity/vocation, overcoming their inherent resistance and sin.

tekstueel_bewijs: God draws near to them both
He puts redemption into our blanket
The God who terrifies is also the one who loves us

object.identificatie: Salvation, New Life, and the 'Enabling Word'
tekstueel_bewijs: the firm ground of their salvation

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Holy One of Israel
tekstueel_bewijs: the source of literally unimaginable promise
from a sphere of power capable of calling into existence the things that do not exist

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearer / Humanity (Gideon, Peter, the Exile, the Addict)
tekstueel_bewijs: You and I are deep in sin
Jesus stoops down to us in our miserable condition

helper.identificatie: The Angel of the Lord / Jesus Christ / The Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: the angel of the Lord is equivalent to the Lord himself
Christ as the one who has power to make our resistance go up in flames
our selfishness, greed, idolatry, cruelty, pettiness
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a force that would lead to being 'lost' and requires a divine 'invasion' to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of following and catching men (vocation) as a result of the primary program.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (Peter/Gideon)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/vocation) only begins after the primary program (grace/fear) has established the 'firm ground'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We are trying to turn ourselves around

voorbeelden: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom
We can understand and even admire the hope
Gideon perceived that he was the angel of the Lord
Power to make our resistance go up in flames
Capable of calling into existence the things that do not exist

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's power to act where humans are powerless (incompetent).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from Sin (~S1) to Terror (S2) and finally to Grace (S1) through the 'Fear Not' (~S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God taking S2 (Judgment) upon Himself in Christ.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; terror is presented as a necessary reaction to the Holy.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject who initiates salvation regardless of human merit or effort.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Human effort mentioned as a 'forlorn hope'
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We are trying to turn ourselves around... admire the hope, however forlorn.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He does not ask us what we are doing... he just gives the gift.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Gideon and Peter are used as examples of human weakness and fear, not as moral models to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God uses the weak and the sinful.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; shift from self-reliance to reliance on God.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative programs are perfectly ordered: God acts, man receives, man is transformed.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Fatal; leads to being 'lost' without intervention.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative structure.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the focus on human passivity in the face of the 'irruption of grace'.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is the 'Grammar of Grace'.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Sin is already treated as a heavy opponent.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon beautifully maintains God as the Subject of all transformative verbs.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the use of the 'crack addict' metaphor, Greimasian analysis shows this metaphor functions as a 'Receiver' actant, reinforcing the theological passivity of the human subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the historical context of Isaiah; this analysis focuses on how the prophet functions as a 'Sender' of divine values in the sermon's current narrative.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'fear of the Lord' is not a moral requirement (Devoir) but a semiotic marker of the Subject's (God) presence.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Exemplarism' trap by focusing on the 'irruption' of the divine rather than the 'imitation' of the biblical character.
